Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior: glazed black with reserved band on which is a black line; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of wreathed male figure (bearded head and part of himation remaining) to right; at right, part of a second figure's hand. Reserved band above.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 47, pl. L, no. 31)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1021)
